metadata.title: Weird Al Yankovic - White and Nerdy
metadata.creator: Weird Al Yankovic

tracks.text: A blue Chevy impala drives down a suburban street. It has a vanity plate reading "O G 4 Life". In the car are black comedians Key and Peele, dressed in hoodies.
They see Yankovic mowing his front lawn. He waves enthusiastically, and they recoil.
Yankovic raps in front of road flares that form an image of pacman.
Yankovic walks up to the impala and tries to shake hands. Startled, Key and Peele try to lock their doors of their topless convertible, then speed off downt he street.
Yankovic watches them drive off and shrugs. He wears a pastel pink polo, beige kakhi pants, thick glasses, and yellow crocs.
In an alley way, Yankovic rolls a D8 and D20.
He points at a silver prius.
Comedian Seth Green points to an elaborate collection of Star Wars, X-Men, and other action figures.
White and Nerdy has 27 friends, including Bill Gates, Napolean Dynamite, and Frodo.
He puts mayonaisse and baloney on wonderbread.
Wearing a shower cap, he showers in glasses under an adjustable height shower head, then types on his Lenovo Thinkpad, which is hardwired into an ethernet port under the shower.
Yankovic and 3 other nerds are gathered around a Trivial Pursuit board. He throws the board in the air.
He points to the cover of the O'Reilly JavaScript book and the DS9-era Klingon emblem, a green, red, and blue trefoil over a yellow circle.
Yankovic rolls through a park on a segway. He wears a blue track suit with a white helmet, pink elbowpads, and yellow kneepads.
Yankovic wears a bulky hoody and long chains. He raps to us, while entertainer Donny Osmond dances behind him. In the background, equations float on a white background.
Yankovic swings a lightsaber around in a garage. He loses control.
On the segway, he gives thumbs up to 2 black men on a porch. They flip him off. He laughs, wags a finger, and segways off.
Yankovic watches as an older woman opens a present. It's a surge protector. She forces a smile.
He writes "You suck" in big letters on the Atlantic Records wikipedia page. He uses Safari on a mac.
Yankovic shows a website called Foofie's Page. The aesthetic is animated clip art.
He play badminton on a lawn with middle aged women.
He sits in a twin sized bed and looks up. Above the headboard are elaborately framed headshots of Kirk and Picard.
Someone pulls his underwear up from his pants. It reads "Alfred".

In an alley way, Yankovic shiftily walks up to a black man, and hands over hundreds in cash. The black man hands a paper bag, and walks away. Yankovic opens the bag to find The Star Wars Holiday Special VHS. He smiles.
Polishing a bowling ball, Yankovic walks up to several blank men at a bowling alley. They look at us, confused.
The black men shake their heads, and point across the bowling alley. 3 white nerds in glasses wave enthusiastically. Cut to black.
